title: Should You Choose Botanist or Tracker in Stardew Valley?

steps.title: Botanist always finds foraged items of the highest quality.
steps.content: Botanist always finds foraged items of the highest quality. For most forageables , this is iridium quality. This can get you a lot of money, as iridium-quality items sell for the most money. [1] X Research source You can also use these forageables as gifts (for villagers that like them) and gain even more friendship points for each gift.

steps.title: Tracker knows the location of forageable items in an area.
steps.content: Tracker knows the location of forageable items in an area. An arrow will appear on the edge of the screen pointing you in the direction of a forageable. This can include seasonable forageables as well as artifact spots. If there's no arrows on the side of your screen when you load into an area, there are no forageables available to be picked up.

steps.title: Botanist is the best choice for most players.
steps.content: Botanist is the best choice for most players. Choosing Botanist will net you the most gold, and has quite a bit of use as you can sell the items you find or give them as gifts. However, finding high-quality forageables will not increase the quality of your artisan goods as ingredient quality doesn't increase the end item quality.

steps.title: If you're looking to collect everything, Tracker may work better for you.
steps.content: If you're looking to collect everything, Tracker may work better for you. With Tracker you'll never miss another artifact spot, and it'll take less time to find any forageable items on the map. You may want to select Tracker if you're looking to complete your Museum faster.

steps.title: If you end up not liking the profession you chose, you can change it in the sewers.
steps.content: If you end up not liking the profession you chose, you can change it in the sewers. After donating 60 items to the Museum, you'll get the Rusty Key . This can be used to unlock the Sewers. In the Sewers is the Statue of Uncertainty, with which you can change your profession. [2] X Research source You must pay 10,000 gold to change your profession at the Statue of Uncertainty.
